htmlform.formName: Oncology - Diagnosis, Staging and Treatment Plan
htmlform.formDescription: Oncology Diagnosis, Staging and Treatment Plan

tr.td:
Oncology Program / Programme d'oncologie
Diagnosis Staging Treatment Plan

td.strong:
Oncology Program / Programme d'oncologie
Diagnosis Staging Treatment Plan

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li: T0 No evidence of primary tumor
Tis Carcinoma in situ only
T1 2 cm
T2 >2 cm, and 5 cm
T3 >5 cm
T4 Involvement of skin or chest wall
N0 No axillary node involvement
N1 Involvement of 1-3 axillary nodes
N2 Involvement of 4-9 axillary nodes
N3 Involvement of 10 axillary nodes, or supraclavicular nodes
M0 No evidence of distant metastases
M1 Evidence of distant metastases (includes cervical adenopathy)
I T1/N0
II T2/N0-1, T1/N1
IV M1

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li: O Tumor in situ or no evidence of primary tumor
I Disease confined to cervix and/or endometrium
IA Microscopic invasive disease only, <7 mm in diameter
IB1 Disease 7 mm and 4 cm
IB2 Disease >4 cm
II Disease beyond cervix but does not extend to pelvic sidewall
III Disease extending to pelvic sidewall
IVA Spread of disease to other pelvic organs such as bladder or rectum
IVB Distant metastases

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li:
T0 Lesion(s) only in the skin and/or the lymph nodes,
and/or there is non-extensive oral disease (Lesions in the mouth are
limited to the palate and are flat)

T1 Edema (swelling) due to the tumor; Extensive oral
disease lesions that are nodular (raised) and/or lesions involve areas of the
mouth besides the palate; Extensive systemic disease (visceral involvement):
Lesions are in organs other than lymph nodes (such as the lungs, the intestine,
the liver, etc.). KS in the lungs is particularly poor risk/prognosis.

I0 CD4 count  200/L (normal range, 600-1500/L);
								alternative 
cut- off proposed is 150, which is what is
								used by more recent studies
I1 CD4 cell count < 200/L

S0 No systemic illness present; ALL of the following are true:
No history of opportunistic infections or thrush; No B symptoms are
present (B symptoms include: unexplained
fever, night sweats (severe enough to soak bedding and clothes),
unintentional weight loss >10%, chronic diarrhea lasting >2 weeks)

S1 Systemic illness present; one or more of the following is true:
History of opportunistic infections or thrush; One or
more B symptoms is present; Other HIV-related illness is present,
such as neurological (nervous system) disease or lymphoma
0 Tumor in situ or no evidence of primary tumor
T1 or T2 lesion with less than 2 lymph nodes involved
II T3 lesion or less with less than 6 lymph nodes involved
III T4 lesion; any T with at least 7 or more lymph nodes involved
IV any T, any N, M1

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

td.span:
*TNM Pathologic Staging Key Sinuses / Nasal cavity
T1 Limited to the sinus without bone erosion
T2 1 subsite invasion or bone erosion
T3 Invasion of posterior wall of maxillary sinus, subcutaneous tissue,
floor or medial wall of the orbit, pterygoid fossa and ethmoid sinus
(for maxillary sinus)
T4 Invasion of the anterior orbit contents and apex, skin of cheek,
pterygoid plates, infratemporal fossa, cribriform plate
(maxillary sinus; T3 for ethmoid sinus and nasal cavity), and sphenoid and frontal sinuses, dura,
brain, middle cranial fossa, cranial nerves (except V2), nasopharynx or clivus

ul.li: N0 No regional node involved
N1 Ipsilateral LN 3 cm

N2 Ipsilateral LN >3 cm and 6 cm; multiple ipsilateral LN;
bilateral or contralateral LN 6 cm
N3 LN >6 cm
M0 No evidence of distant metastases
M1 Evidence of distant metastases
T1 2 cm
T2 >2 cm, and 4 cm
T3 >4 cm
T4 Invasion of adjacent organs (different depending on site of disease)
T1 Vocal cord mobility preserved
T2 Decreased vocal cord mobility
T3 Vocal cord fixation
T4 Invasion through thyroid cartilage or tissues beyond larynx
T1 No parapharyngeal extension

T2 Parapharyngeal extension (posterolateral
infiltration beyond pharyngobasilar fascia)
T3 Invasion of bony structures of skull base and/or paranasal sinuses

T4 Intracranial extension and/or involvement of intracranial nerves,
infratemporal fossa, hypopharynx, orbit or masticator space

N1 Unilateral lymph node(s) or in the midline
6 cm, above the supraclavicular fossa
N2 Bilateral lymph nodes 6 cm, above the supraclavicular fossa
N3 LN >6 cm or extension into the supraclavicular fossa
M1 Evidence of distant metastases

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li: T0 No evidence of primary tumor
Tis Carcinoma in situ
T1 Tumor invades submucosa
T2 Tumor invades muscularis propria

T3 Tumor pentrates subserosal connective tissue
without invasion into adjacent structures or visceral peritoneum
T4 Tumor invades serosa or adjacent structures
N0 No regional lymph node involvement
N1 Metastasis in 1-2 regional lymph nodes
N2 Metastasis in 3-6 regional lymph nodes
N3 Metastasis in 7 or more regional lymph nodes
M0 No evidence of distant metastases
M1 Evidence of distant metastases
0 Tumor in situ or no evidence of primary tumor
T1 or T2 lesion with less than 2 lymph nodes involved
II T3 lesion or less with less than 6 lymph nodes involved
III T4 lesion; any T with at least 7 or more lymph nodes involved
IV any T, any N, M1

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li: T0 No evidence of primary tumor
Tis Carcinoma in situ: intraepithelial or invasion of lamina propria
T1 Submucosa invasion
T2 Muscularis propria invasion
T3 Invasion through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues

T4 Tumor penetrates to the surface of visceral peritoneum
and/or invades or attach other organs and structures

N0 No regional node involved (at least 12 negative
nodes should be available on the specimen)
N1 1-3 regional nodes involved
N2 Metastasis in 3-6 regional lymph nodes
N3 >3 regional nodes involved
M0 No evidence of distant metastases
M1 Evidence of distant metastasis

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li: T0 No evidence of prostate tumor
T1 Clinical inapparent tumor found on biopsy
T2 Tumor confined to prostate gland
T3 Tumor extends through capsule
T4 Tumor fixed, or extends to surrounding structures
N0 No regional lymph node involvement
N1 Regional lymph node involvement
M0 No evidence of distant metastases
M1 Evidence of distant metastasis

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

td.span:
*Overall Staging Key SIOP staging: based upon surgical evaluation after administration of chemotherapy to reduce the size of the tumor
I Tumor is fully resected and is limited to the kidney, or if outside the kidney, it is surrounded with a fibrous pseudocapsule. Tumor may be found in the renal capsule, pelvic system (but not involving the ureter walls), and intrarenal vessels. There is no evidence of renal sinus vessel involvement or tumor at or beyond the margins of resection.
II Tumor extends beyond the kidney or fibrous pseudocapsule but is completely resected without evidence of tumor at or beyond the margins of resection. Tumor infiltrates, which are completely resected, can extend into the renal sinus, blood vessels and lymph nodes beyond the renal parenchyma, adjacent organs, or vena cava.
III After surgery, residual tumor remains but is confined to the abdomen. This includes regional lymph node involvement, incomplete resection of the tumor, tumor penetration of the peritoneal surface, tumor thrombi of vessels at resection margins, tumor spillage, or previous biopsy. There is no evidence of hematogenous metastasis.
IV Hematogenous metastasis (e.g. lung, liver, bone, brain) or lymph node involvement beyond the abdominopelvic region.
V Bilateral renal involvement is present at the time of diagnosis.

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

td.span:
*Staging Key Small cell lung cancer
Limited stage Disease confined to one lung, without pleural involvement, but ipsilateral mediastinal involvement allowed
Extensive stage Disease outside of one lung, pleural effusion, cardiac involvement, contralateral lung involvement and distant metastases

ul.li: T0 No evidence of primary tumor
T1 3 cm without invasion of bronchus or other chest structures

T2 >3 cm 7 cm, >2 cm from carina, can invade visceral pleura,
but not other surrounding chest structures
T3 >7 cm, or invades chest wall, pericardium, diaphragm, mediastinal pleura
T4 Tumor of any size invading heart, mediastinum great vessels, esophagus
N0 No nodal involvement
N1 Ipsilateral peri-bronchial or hilar nodes
N2 Ipsilateral mediastinal or subcarinal nodes
N3 Contralateral mediastinal or hilar nodes, and supraclavicular nodes
M0 No evidence of distant metastases
M1 Evidence of distant metastases
0 Tumor in situ or no evidence of primary tumor
I T < 5 cm and N0
III-B T1-4/N3, T4/N2
IV M1

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)
Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)
(bulky disease is defined as > 10cm in greatest dimension)
(presence of fevers, night sweats, and/or >10% body weight loss)

ul.li: O Tumor in situ or unable to assess primary tumor
I Lymph node disease, one site of involvement
II Lymph node disease, 2 or more sites of involvement on the same side of diaphragm
III Lymph node disease, on both sides of the diaphragm
IV Extra-nodal disease, bone marrow, lung, liver

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)
Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

ul.li: Accelerated No set definition but of concern when >10% blasts in periphery or marrow; chromosomal changes other than 9; 22; >20% eos plus basos in blood; extramedullary leukemia (skin, etc)
Blast crisis >25% myeloblasts or lymphoblasts in BM in patient with history of CML or 9; 22 translocation in all lineages

tr.td: Confirmed Diagnosis Details (include a copy of pathology report in chart)

obs.answerLabel: A: relatively normal renal function (serum creatinine value <2.0 mg/dl)
B: abnomal renal function (serum creatinine >2.0 mg/dl)

ul.li: I All of the following: Hb >10 g/Lt; Serum Ca2+ normal (<12 mg/dl); X-rays: normal bone structure or solitary bone plasmacytoma only; Low M-component production rates: IgG value <5 g/dL, IgA value <3 g/dL, Urine light chain M-component on electrophoresis <4 g/24h
II Overall data are minimally abnormal as shown for stage I and no single value as abnormal as defined for stage III

III One or more of the following: Hb <8.5 g/Lt; Serum Ca2+ >12 g/dl; Advanced lytic bone lesions (scale 3); High M-component production rates: IgG value >7 g/dl, IgA value >5 g/dl, Urine light chain M-component on electrophoresis >12 g/24h

lookup.complexExpression: #set($obsGroupList = []) #foreach($encounter in $fn.allEncounters(null)) #foreach($obs in $encounter.obs) #if( $obs.obsGroup.concept.uuid == '3cd95d5a-26fe-102b-80cb-0017a47871b2' ) #if( ($obsGroupList.contains($obs.obsGroup)) ) #else #set($_usls =$obsGroupList.add($obs.obsGroup)) #end #end #end #end #foreach($obsGroup in $obsGroupList) #foreach($o in $obsGroup.groupMembers) #if( $o.concept.uuid == '3cd95ed6-26fe-102b-80cb-0017a47871b2' ) #set($causes = $o.valueCoded.name) #elseif( $o.concept.uuid == '3cd96052-26fe-102b-80cb-0017a47871b2' ) #set($reaction = $o.valueCoded.name) #elseif( $o.concept.uuid == '3cd964bc-26fe-102b-80cb-0017a47871b2' ) #set($year = $o.valueDatetime) #end #end $causes $reaction $year #end
